required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial of Transnasal Humidified Rapid-Insufflation Ventilatory Exchange (THRIVE) Oxygen in Women Having Planned Caesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial of Transnasal Humidified Rapid-Insufflation Ventilatory Exchange (THRIVE) Oxygen in Women Having Planned Caesarean Delivery

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical Trial of Transnasal Humidified Rapid-Insufflation Ventilatory Exchange (THRIVE) Oxygen in Women having Planned Caesarean Delivery. Cohort study investigating the efficacy of THRIVE pre-oxygenation using pre-determined number of vital capacity breaths and comparing the efficacy to face mask pre-oxygenation. Aimed to recruit ASA 1-2 term pregnant women having elective caesarean section.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of vital capacity breaths required using THRIVE to pre-oxygenate 90% of parturients to an end tidal oxygen concentration of â‰¥90% (EN90). End tidal oxygen concentration >= 0.9
primary_outcome.description: measure end tidal oxygen concentration through breathing system attached to anaesthetic machine

secondary_outcome.measure: EN90 using THRIVE with mouth open versus mouth closed
secondary_outcome.description: to measure any difference in end tidal oxygen concentration after using THRIVE mouth closed versus THRIVE mouth open
using 4-point Likert scale (1 being very uncomfortable- 4 comfortable)

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in fetal wellbeing during pre-oxygenation time

intervention.description: Clinical Trial of Transnasal Humidified Rapid-Insufflation Ventilatory Exchange (THRIVE) Oxygen in Women having Planned Caesarean Delivery

study_pop.textblock: term pregnant women undergoing elective Caesarean section

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- scheduled to undergo elective caesarean delivery
- singleton pregnancy
- American Society of Anaesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status Grade II
- gestational age between 37 - 42 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- multiple pregnancy
- pre-eclampsia
- known fetal abnormality
- maternal cardio-respiratory comorbidity
- Body Mass Index (BMI) > 35 kg/m2.
